scheme_name: International Cooperation Scheme- Capacity Building of First Time MSE Exporters
description: The International Cooperation Scheme aims to enhance the export capabilities of first-time Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) by providing financial assistance for capacity building. It supports participation in international trade fairs, buyer-seller meets, and other export-related activities to promote global market access.
key_features: Capacity building through training and exposure
Facilitates international market access for MSEs

benefits.reimbursement: Up to 75% of expenses for participation in international events, max Rs. 10 Lakhs
benefits.training_support: Free or subsidized export training programs
benefits.market_access: Support for buyer-seller meets and trade fairs

business_criteria: Must be a registered Micro or Small Enterprise (MSE) as per the MSME Development Act, 2006
First-time exporters or MSEs with limited export experience
operational_criteria: Must participate in approved international trade fairs, exhibitions, or buyer-seller meets
Must have a valid Udyam Registration

eligible_activities: Participation in international trade fairs and exhibitions

steps: Visit the MSME portal or the International Cooperation Scheme website
Register and submit an application with details of the proposed export activity
Upload required documents, including Udyam Registration and event details
Applications are reviewed by the MSME Ministry
Approved applicants receive funding post-event upon submission of claims
application_process.note: Reimbursement is processed after submitting proof of participation and expenses

special_notes: Funding is subject to approval of the event by the MSME Ministry
MSEs must submit claims within the stipulated time frame
Priority is given to MSEs from underrepresented sectors
